flawed_nl_solution:
First find the weekly cost of the first employee: $20/hour * 40 hours/week = $<<20*40=8000>>8000/week
Then find the hourly cost of the second employee after the government subsidy: $22/hour - $6/hour = $<<22-6=16>>16/hour
Then find the weekly cost of the second employee: $16/hour * 40 hours/week = $<<16*40=640>>640/week
Then subtract the smaller weekly cost from the bigger weekly cost to find the difference: $8000/week - $640/week = $<<8000-640=7360>>7360/week
#### 7360

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 800, not 8000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
